website_summaries.verdict: These earplugs really shine for their design that allows for extreme comfort and are perfect for anyone looking to wear earplugs discreetly.
pros: Minimalist design makes these earplugs discreet and virtually invisible
Comfortable and flexible build that comes in different sizes
Specially designed to create a seal within the ear rather than resting close to ear canal like other models
cons: These don’t come with cord, which makes it easier to misplace plugs

customer_reviews.title: Good hearing protecting that doesn't sacrifice sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three sets of these for a (very loud) rock concert. All three people who used them (including me) were very happy with them. They reduced the overall decibels, but the music remained clear and enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Romard

customer_reviews.title: Great difficulty removing them m once inserted in ear
customer_reviews.text: Disliked and will be returning Problem is the small piece you use to remove the ear plugs is way too short and had great difficulty removing the earplugs causing anxiety Plus,once inserted in my ears the sound reduction was very minimal and not nearly enough sound cancelling to be effective Mainly I found them very difficult to remove from ears regardless of size of the plug itself Too difficult to remove to warrant taking a chance using them Frankly, I found them somewhat scary and worried about being able to remove them Very poor design in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Sixgun

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Dishonest; Negligible Noise Reduction
customer_reviews.text: The advertising on this product is extremely misleading. They claim up to 22db sound reduction several times in the description, and yet only have a noise reduction rating of 15db. Since nrr does not mean the same thing as quantity of dB attenuated (the industry standard is to subtract 7 and divide by 2), these earbuds are going to help by approximately (15-7)/2 = 4db. That's half of the value I was expecting. Pathetic. I'd ask for my money back if they allowed returns. I'm not surprised that they don't, given the absurd ineffecacy of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: About the same quality as disposable ear plugs from any ...
customer_reviews.text: About the same quality as disposable ear plugs from any store. I'm a musician and was swayed by other reviews saying you could still hear clearly when wearing them. You can't.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Diva

customer_reviews.title: Not good for shows, ears were still ringing afterwards
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying these to protect your ears at shows look elsewhere. I am really disappointed that they seemed to offer little protection from loud music. My ears are still ringing the next morning and I wasn't even in front of the amps. They are comfortable but that doesn't matter if they don't do their job. I will be returning these and looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: CitznFish

customer_reviews.title: Fake and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs seemed like a great idea. I was really excited about them. Turns out they are made from a very cheap material. It’s literally a tiny plastic tube with a silicone dome shoved onto the end of it. The silicone rips if you try and take it off to clean, or change size, even if you are gentle. Also, it is extremely easy to push this too far into your canal, and very easy for someone to bump into you and shove it right into your drum. Go get some 10 cent foamies. They do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ensing

customer_reviews.title: The ear vibes did not work for me. They ...
customer_reviews.text: The ear vibes did not work for me. They did not filter out sounds which is what I was looking for. I am looking for a ear plug I can use at my bar and hear orders.. Also they did not stay in my ear, they kept falling out of my ears. I tried all three sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Earplugs don't work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs do not work as advertised. Total and complete waste of money. They can't be returned either. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Max Rath

customer_reviews.title: It didn't help me at all.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited after reading about these earplugs and how many they helped. So I was very disappointed today when I finally got a chance to use them. I could honestly not tell any difference when they were in or out, nor did trying different sizes change it.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Lane

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst investment I’ve done in my life!!!
customer_reviews.text: All the materials used for this product can’t cost more than 3 USD. I bought it because I work in a noise place, to reduce noise is OK but if you have to talk constantly is a big problem because you have to scream almost to hear yourself. I lost one on the first day of use so I had to improvise and cut a drinking straw and stick it to one of the replacement bud... 🙄🙄🙄 you can build it yourself without having to invest 25 USD.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe O.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am autistic and without these I would be wearing earmuffs everyday. I have extreme sound sensitivity and mild touch sensitivity so I struggle to wear regular ear plugs. These are so comfortable that I can wear them all day. They allow me to hear other people speaking and just lower all the volume of everything which is exactly what I need. I lost a pair and had to rebuy them immediately because I have a hard time without them. A+
customer_reviews.author: Sparrow Russell

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I have Aspergers and sensory processing issues so given the positive feedback from many in the autism community I gave them a shot. They fit nicely. Easy to put in and take out. The dont get itchy or feel like your ear is crammed with tight fit foam. However, they do not really block or filter sound much. They simply seem to turn the volume down just a little not a lot and dilute background noise. I was expecting better. Id used them at a theme park to tone down screamimg children and noise from rides and they didnt help really much at all.
customer_reviews.author: XcrackyX

customer_reviews.title: These have been life changing for me. Due to ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been life changing for me. Due to personal health issues I have become very sensitive to sounds. These are a way to get through loud birthday party’s, my daughter activities, concerts, or even church services. I can hear what I need to hear without being bothered by all the accumulation of background noises. All doing so discretely. Thank you for inventing this product. Also l love the tiny hard case. I keep them in my purse at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No big difference
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fit. There didn’t seem to be much of a difference between wearing the HI-Fidelity Earplugs and not wearing them. I do not recommend these earplugs. I thought if I payed more I would get what I payed for. Sorry, but I am not satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SuperMom

customer_reviews.title: Vibes allows me to be in a crowd again!
customer_reviews.text: I have a sensory processing disorder as a result of shingles inside my ear. I cried in church the first time I wore these earplugs. I was not on sensory overload! I could stay in the service- I could understand what the pastor was saying-I could enjoy the choir! Thank you Vibes for giving me the ability to come out of my isolation!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn W.

customer_reviews.title: A relief for sensitive ears
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to reduce the background noises at work. I am extremely sensitive to sounds (especially chewing, loud breathers, etc) and work in a cubicle where I can hear everything. Vibes earplugs have saved me from losing my mind. They do not cancel out noise completely, so I can hear when people are talking directly to me without losing quality, but I no longer hear the background noises of cubicle mates that drove me crazy. Very happy with my purchase and definitely worth a shot if you want to still hear people talking to you directly but want to filter out background noises.
customer_reviews.author: Noble

customer_reviews.title: Just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear to live music concerts. They definitely did the trick. I could still hear the music without it being too loud. I only gave the product 3 stars for the following reasons: 1. I wish it came with a better carrying case....very easy to lose this case....the case is very small and chintzy. And it would be better if the case had compartments for all the different size earbuds, so everything could be kept in one spot. 2. I have never tried any other ear plugs, so I have no frame of reference.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: The sound cancellation is fine. The problem is that these are definitely NOT made for motorcycles: it is IMPOSSIBLE to get a full-faced helmet on wearing these. Normal ear protection is fine because it is squishy - these have a hard plastic part that just pops right out of your ears when you put it on. Oh, and if after hours of struggling you do get them, when you take the helmet back off - pop! They fly out and land on the floor. So +5 for noise cancellation, and -5 for misleading advertising. Now let's see if they take returns....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected!  ... But they refunded my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit well (tried all 3 tips) and made me feel like I was shouting. I raised the star rating to a 3/5 because the customer service was 1st class. They issued a refund with in a few hours of my not so positive review. I think they would be better if custom fit molded pillows were available. The right ear was comfortable and "sealed" but the left had some type of air gap that allowed for distortion to leak through. Give them a try and decide on your own but this was my experience. Final Thoughts.... Zero risk because a refund was offered to correct my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: Vibes are perfect for sensory issues! They are comfy (a must for those with sensory problems) and are discreet. Better yet, they do there job! While wearing Vibes, you can hear with perfect clarity (except your own voice sounds funny as if you were sticking your fingers in your ears), but everything is dulled. It's hard to put into words how well they work, but they do! Recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: SGIC

customer_reviews.title: Discreet option for sound-sensitive kiddos!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old son has autism - and these work perfectly to allow him to discreetly enjoy public places, especially church on Sunday morning! He asked us for an option less obvious than noise-cancelling-headphones, and is not typically a fan of ear plugs, but the three different sizes included in this pack made for an easy and comfortable fit. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Elkins

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FOR MOTORCYCLING
customer_reviews.text: I did not test out the noise cancellation of these earplugs. They seem fine for most uses EXCEPT for motorcycling. A hard plastic piece protrudes out of the ear by half an inch. If one were to take a spill while riding a motorcycle this could jam into the inner-ear. I'm rating 1 star for this serious lack of awareness on the seller's part and suggest they should remove that as part of the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: I know they are better than nothing if I want to continue with this ...
customer_reviews.text: I waited to use them before rating.... I bought them because of an over-zealous yoga instructor who plays the music far too loud for the health of my ears. They definitely damped the sound, but I'm not sure it was enough. I used the small sized buds (glad for the size options) and they stayed in during a hot (read sweaty) vinyasa class for an hour. I could still hear the instructor, for the most part, even when he (and the music) was quieter. I know they are better than nothing if I want to continue with this class, I'm just not certain how much they reduce the decibels my ears receive.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Do not order
customer_reviews.text: These don't block any sound. I can still hear the air conditioning in the car and the creaks of the car. I hear screaming and all that. I have a processing disorder and needed something to really dampen sound. The listing says 22 dB but the box clearly says only 15. Misleading and a waste of money. They are super uncomfortable and take away NO SOUND. Do not waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln Myers

customer_reviews.title: Good for Musicians
customer_reviews.text: I'm a saxophone player in a jazz band and was looking for something to protect my hearing during rehearsal while allowing me to hear every part. I've recently started developing some tinnitus, so this was a must for me. At first, I hated them, only because I never wear earplugs and didn't like the feeling. After rehearsing with them, I can say they effectively lowered the volume of everything while allowing me to hear everyone else and myself pretty clearly. These are miles better than standard foam earplugs, are reusable, and definitely worth the price. They do get a little uncomfortable after a couple hours, but they are still the most comfortable plugs I've ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Tryon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my preschooler, who has sensory issues with loud noises. He used to enjoy car shows but recently became sensitive to loud pipes and would cover his ears when cars would approach or start up. After trying these Vibes with him for the first time, he was still able to hear us at normal conversation level and responded normally, and at the car show tonight did not cover his ears once. He was like his old self and able to enjoy the show. So happy these were helpful to him. I ordered a second pair so I can try them at loud events too.
customer_reviews.author: Rhyno

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Dampening
customer_reviews.text: I found these headphones very comfortable in the ear, with no added pressure, very lightweight, and stayed put. However, they blocked too much sound for a concert - there has to be a balance between noise cancelation and allowing you to hear the music. I found that these in particular block too much, and leave me feeling like I did when I used disposable earplugs at concerts. I will keep them around for general use, such as motorcycle rides or whatnot, but won't be using them again for concerts.
customer_reviews.author: J. PearsonTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Mostly perfect! Slightly annoying...
customer_reviews.text: Let me begin by saying I have used these ear plugs several times and functionally they are perfect, hence 4 stars. I have 1 minor complaint and 1 annoyance. Minor complaint: I had to swap out the carrying case to one that had a little caribiner on it so I can locate it in the dark in my purse, as well as easily transfer it to a new purse. The little case it comes in is not really functional or practical. Annoyance: there is a Ridge on the circumference of the ear plug part that after a few minutes really begins to agitate my ears. I’ve tried the different sizes provided and nothing seems to help. This is a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Workaholic

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Misophonia sufferers!
customer_reviews.text: I can finally exist happily in my office environment thanks to these ear plugs. I have misophonia which makes noises unbearable but these worked perfect to ease the volume of the noises I hear daily. It's a must have for people who have misophonia, auditory issues, or feel sensory overload from sounds. I'm so happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Quesadilla Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: While these did seem to both protect and allow for clarity, the "studs" on these are much too short and smooth which made getting these out of my ears with my fingers impossible. I had to go get needlenose pliers to remove them even though I only inserted them far enough to "seal" and I tried each of the three sizes.
customer_reviews.author: arboritionist

customer_reviews.title: A BIG Help For Auditory Sensory Issues
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Vibes! They are small, comfortable, and they do a great job of cancelling out background noise. They do really work well. The only question I have is, could the clear plastic stem that extends out from the ear be make a little bit shorter? Vibes are almost completely invisible, but I have short hair that doesn't cover my ears. The stem is a little bit noticeable when I wear them. Overall, though, this product is a BIG help for people with auditory sensory problems!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: My ears are so much happier at the gym now!
customer_reviews.text: I love my boutique gym, but my sensitive ears actually HURT most days (especially when the trainers are men, because they seem to crank it up more than the women trainers!). I finally hit my limit and looked up "drummer's earplugs" at the advice of a fellow gym-goer. These are fabulous and I'll tell you why: 1) Nobody can see them. I shouldn't be worried about what people will think, but sometimes covering your precious ears can make people think you're a pansy (seriously, people suck sometimes! Why is protecting your hearing considered "weak"?!). This way I can avoid any comments. They're pretty much invisible! 2) They STAY PUT. Through the hardest, bounciest kickboxing workout, they don't budge.
customer_reviews.author: L. J. FINE

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the expense. Painful.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't notice any difference with sound dampening using these over other silicone styles. These actually hurt my ears worse even with trying the 3 different size tips and readjusting to try and find the right position for comfort without affecting the sound level. Foam ear plugs blocked more sound by far. Not worth the high price. I don't care if they were on a stupid TV show. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: TD-RN

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Fall Out on a Motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: If you wear a full-face motorcycle helmet these are not the earbuds for you. They have these tubes that stick out of your ears and they will get caught on the inside of your helmet when you put the helmet on or off. They go into ears securely but the helmet loosens the seal and they no longer work. Might as well not have them in. I tried different ear cup sizes to no avail. I kept trying different ways to put them in and they still did not work with a helmet. One eventually fell out of my ear during a ride and is now lost to me forever :(
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed- broken after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited when I bought these ear plugs for my music-loving boyfriend. Unfortunately, after two uses, one of them is cracked, and the other has a tear on the rubber pad. The rubber part tore as he was trying to switch it out for a different sized rubber part (various sizes are provided in the package), but the crack is mysterious. He just took them out after a show and the plastic portion had cracked. He's kept them in a case, so it's not like the plastic cracked from mis-handling. Unfortunately, he can't use them anymore, for fear a small bit of the plastic could break off and end up in his ear canal.
customer_reviews.author: mn

customer_reviews.title: Great for older ears
customer_reviews.text: I have some hearing issues now and cannot tolerate the volume of sounds at a concert. I used these twice to see my favorite performers and they worked great. My ears were not ringing after being in the arena with those giant speakers. I noticed the music was cleaner and made the event more enjoyable. These are so tiny that it is hard to keep up with them in the little case. Don't forget you have them in your pocket or purse.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Kinnard

customer_reviews.title: Wore these (with the add-on mini-lanyard) for two weekend-long festivals
customer_reviews.text: I picked the larger-sized plugs, and my wife picked the medium-sized ones. Unlike the foam earplugs (and/or randomly-grabbed bar napkins) we've used for years, these let in a balanced level of sound. Perhaps still not quite enough protection to stand directly in front of a 20' high wall of speakers side-stage, but certainly worked great front&center stage, as well as various other very-loud stages and amphitheaters. Comfortable for all-day use. We actually keep them in the little dental-floss-like containers between shows. Note: If you have waxy ears, clean your ears BEFORE the show, and clean the plugs each night AFTER the show. Otherwise you're just pushing dirt in there.
customer_reviews.author: CISSP

customer_reviews.title: The best earplugs that I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best earplugs that I’ve ever used. They stay in and are comfortable. I’m extremely sensitive to loudness and wore these to a concert. Best ever! Took the sound down a notch but I could still hear the great music loud and clear. Won’t leave home without these!
customer_reviews.author: actcan

customer_reviews.title: So comfy, so clean
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable plugs you can get without buying custom molds I have found. Been through a lot of different plugs over the years and can't help but come back to vibes every time. Buy them for my concert buddies all the time as a good holiday present or birthday gift! The sound is really clear as well. The only downside is it doesn't reduce sound by a whole lot, so if you are a raver or metal concert goer you may want to consider a higher dB reduction. For most other music these are the plugs you want!
customer_reviews.author: Shane G.

customer_reviews.title: These plugs do a great job filtering them down so as not to be ...
customer_reviews.text: I have very sensitive ears especially when it is drums or base guitar. These plugs do a great job filtering them down so as not to be as loud --- maybe by 1/3rd? I was in the front row of "Bluegrass Underground" and used these plugs. I was approximately 10-15' from the drums and they did not bother my ears. I took one out of my ear just to test the difference and I could not stand to have it out. So I definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: JayLoK

customer_reviews.title: Still somewhat muffled
customer_reviews.text: Babymetal concert at House of Blues, but used Vibes, first, for the opening band. After the first band, I decided to take them out and was able to enjoy Babymetal much better without the Vibes. Even though I could hear more sound than regular ear plugs, it was, still, too muffled sounding. That takes away from the pleasure of the performance. What I expected and the actual results are a little disappointing. Maybe, at a different venue, these might come in handy. Some bands play super loud, and sometimes the sound crew doesn't always get it right. Let's see, as time goes on, what future results will gather.
customer_reviews.author: A. Farkas

customer_reviews.title: Best plugs for live music
customer_reviews.text: I have been to a lot of concerts since I was young and it's starting to affect my hearing. I have tried many ear plugs but always end up taking them out because they sacrifice the sound and quality of the music way too much. These on the other hand do not. They perfectly filter the music and it's the only plugs I have been able to go through an entire concert with and forget that I have them in. Truly glad to have come across these. I even use them at the gym or noisy places just because it doesn't cancel out the noise around you but filters it and makes it bearable.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvie Valmaggi

customer_reviews.title: Ear insurance
customer_reviews.text: These work well. World of a difference compared to traditional foam ear plugs, which are unsightly and uncomfortable. I only use these for concerts and work wonderfully. Not sure of the science behind it but rather than simply muffling sound, these seem to filter out certain tones or frequencies that make loud environments uncomfortable and unsafe. Fitment is exceptional for most since they have included 3 different sized plugs. What's better is they are very inconspicuous and don't cause any soreness for hours on end. Great insurance to keep your ears in check for years to come. Plus, these are reusable, so less waste.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Posada

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, discreet, and they work!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 57 and used them last night at a bar in DC at “Cryfest” - two DJs alternating between The Cure and The Smiths (and I was not the oldest there). These ear plugs made all the difference in the world! Comfortable and discreet. The dulled the highs perfectly and turned everything down. I took one out to see the difference and was surprised how well they worked. I was there for three hours - I would not have lasted 30 mins without them. No ear ringing after or the next day. I enjoyed the music and could still talk people. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: I. Band

customer_reviews.title: Such a better concert experience..
customer_reviews.text: I've been going to concerts for 40 years, mostly metal. After the latest Knotfest I thought it might be a good time to try some ear plugs. I had a chance to use them when Korn. My all time favorite band, so this was a big test. My reaction? Where have these been my whole life?! Very comfortable right from the start but most importantly was the overall sound improvement. The vocals were much clearer, the bass not as muddled. It took them out on occasion, just to note the difference and immediately put them back in. Such a small price to pay for such an improvement in my concert experience.
customer_reviews.author: Derek D Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Edit: it's been over a month and I'm obsessed. I don't like background noise when I'm reading, these make it so much more comfortable to read for long periods of time and ignore the TV blaring. I bought these about a week ago for a lot of reasons. I love concerts, I like my hearing intact, I don't want to hear my coworkers, etc. I can unfortunately still hear my coworkers & any music playing in the background. But! Everything and I do mean everything is at a much more tolerable level. I never want to take these out. Luckily they're comfy enough that I rarely have to
customer_reviews.author: Bex

customer_reviews.title: Life changing for sound sensitivity!
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs changed my life! I get sound sensitive, and for years I’ve had to skip certain events and gatherings because my brain registers the noise as louder than it actually is. I’d heard of those expensive noise cancelling headphones and tried out a friend’s pair, but they didn’t seem to help. These, though, work wonders and are so cheap! So far I’ve worn them to a noisy restaurant, a conference with music, and a parade. I would have had to skip all those events if it wasn’t for the earplugs. I also like how inconspicuous they are, and they come in a handy little plastic case.
customer_reviews.author: S. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Great Audio Sensory Helper
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to assist me in overcoming audio sensory problems at work. They do a great job of blocking out the background noise such as lights, radios, refrigeration units turning on and off, etc while allowing me to hear conversations I need to be a part of even when the conversation is behind me. I also have tactile sensory problems and these are comfortable most of the time. Only when I am already in sensory overload are they difficult to tolerate.
customer_reviews.author: justashopper

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: I work in the dental field and have had these recommended to me by numerous people so I thought I would give them a try due to all the high frequency instruments. I put the smallest size on them and they still seemed too big. They gave me massive headaches every time i wore them and i felt like i was just listening to things underwater. I found when speaking, I could not hear other people talking at all. I did not care for how they made noise sound to me, and of course not the headaches either. For me they were not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome to reduce noise and yet allow conversation.
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds have saved me socially. I've almost become a hermit since a concussion left me a bit off, TBI. If you're looking for something that quiets your surroundings, aren't intrusive, and allow you to join conversations these are for you. I keep them with me always, super for grocery stores, restaurants, and those noisy family gatherings. I will say, I don't like speaking with them as I can't regulate my volume very well and you get the 'echo' which is not good for migraines. If you're looking for complete noise canceling, these aren't for you.
customer_reviews.author: L Cole

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe these things.
customer_reviews.text: I was a Hear-O's user for a while, until one night after a gig I forgot to put them back into my plug holder and lost/destroyed them on the dancefloor. These are much more compact and function pretty identically. They're much smaller, so they don't get bent or cramped in my keychain holder. They do have a tendency to work themselves loose gradually, but that may be because I sweat a lot when I play. I thought I was getting a pair for $12, but they sent me two! I gave a pair to my bassist and he was incredibly impressed with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes away the sting/hurting wave length
customer_reviews.text: Description for this item was very true. I have a hearing sensitivity (very 'sensitive nerve') condition. I have been using foam ear plugs for hearing protection. I only used Vibe for a day and I can tell the difference right away. It cuts the sting/sharp hurting sound from all pitches - high pitch to low pitch sounds. I am able to hear the conversation clearly. It has a small chip inside and I think it sorts-out/minimizes sound wave length which hurts the ear entering the ear canal. I only used it for commute to work (bus, train, walking) not for concerts. Vibe eliminates the sting/sharp hurting wave length from sound so it's a joy to walk outside now! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: If you are a veteran metal-head concert goer, get these (unless you're already deaf)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a set of these at the advisement of three very good fellow metal-head friends of mine who warned me that if I didn't get these, the constant ringing in my ears that I once thought was normal would become worse; ten fold to be exact. Though these earplugs do reduce the noise I so thoroughly enjoy, these became essential accessories for me when I attended concerts and I was up near the stage or in close proximity to giant guitar amps. I'm glad I invested in these and though I don't always use them at every concert, it's good to have them on me just in case I find myself upfront and center in the mosh pit. SLAYER!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Ace

customer_reviews.title: Don't work under a motorcycle helmet
customer_reviews.text: The little plastic rods that stick out of the plugs are very handy for putting the earplugs in your ears but if you try to put a motorcycle (or any other) helmet on they catch on the helmet and come out of your ears. In general they are very comfortable but I'm not sure that they do any good. I can get the old foam plugs for 25¢ and they take out most of the sound. If I want more sound I just loosen them up. Cheap, easy, don't have to worry about losing my $25 ear plugs.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sanford

customer_reviews.title: My experience
customer_reviews.text: This product is "Okay" only. The noise cancelation is probably about 25%. Which means I heard all of the fireworks on the 4th, dogs barking& fire sirens. I wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.author: csoluvlee

customer_reviews.title: Great for working with kids
customer_reviews.text: You'll get exactly what you pay for here. A very comfortable, discreet, and overall convenient pair of ear plugs. They're not going to block all the sound out, don't get your hopes up. They're going to take the edge off in order to reduce chances of hearing loss later in life. I use them around my family of 5 kids for when everyone is having fits at once and I need to be able to hear myself think. I am actually able to make out speech quite well when using these. I'm satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tan.vs.wild

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough for a Doom Metal Show
customer_reviews.text: So I used this for a Bell Witch show. All of the fidelity came out, but the volume in my ears was at such a level I would not go experience hearing loss. The case is also useful since you do not have to fish out stuck earplugs from the bottom. They are fantastic value for the money since ones hearing is priceless, especially for a musician or music fan.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Good for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my motorcycle. I wear a 3/4 shell helmet and had no issues unlike some other people said. They're easy to get in and out and do a good job of reducing the noise. They are not as good (for sound) as the foam style, but are much faster to put in. Also, you can talk at normal volume and fully understand them. For long (2+ hr) rides, I will probably keep using the foam disposable ones. but for normal trips/rides I will be thrilled with these. (My bike is a cruiser with drag pipes)
customer_reviews.author: James Milton

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable for to wear for long periods, Could us a bit more Db reduction.
customer_reviews.text: I am a drummer that already lives with tinnitus playing in loud, live music club/stage environments. I found the Vibes to be comfortable to wear for long periods, and they do a good job allowing for conversational level volumes, while providing a wide tonal range without sounding muffled or isolated. But for my application, I could use a bit more Db reduction, especially over 2-4 hour long performances. Caveat that I've only used the medium cups as originally provided. I might try the small and see if the insertion might be better? Lastly, I didn't want to wear something that was overtly noticable, and there can barely be seen, even with my smaller head/ears! :)
customer_reviews.author: MichaelD

customer_reviews.title: Vibe earplugs do what they advertise.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Vibe ear plugs to wear in my exercise classes, specifically spinning, pound, and cardio dance. I’ve used them for a couple of weeks and find them to be perfect for my needs. They stay in my ears, they’re comfortable, the silicone plugs come in 3 sizes, and they block the extremely loud music while I’m still able to hear the instructors. I now wear them in the car while listening to music which I tend to crank up. Lately I’ve been wearing them while using my blow dryer and vacuum sweeper. I plan to purchase a second pair to keep in my gym bag while this set will be used for home. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: stella

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but question the level of sound reduction
customer_reviews.text: Due to COVID restrictions I have been unable to try them at a concert. But trying them at home they were pretty comfortable and easy to insert. They did reduce sound levels. I was looking for concert ear protection and tried 3 different brands, EARPEACE and EARGASM were the other two. Unfortunately eargasm which comes in 3 sizes, did not fit my ears comfortably in any size. I found the EARPEACE to be the most comfortable, and easy to insert. The EARPEACE come with 3 levels of filter with the middle level installed and these provided much better sound reduction than the VIBES while maintaining a high quality of sound.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Eisenman

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Sharktank!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have now purchased 2 sets of them (lost one in my other set) because I have a sensitivity to sound and have a sensory processing disorder. Because I don't like tight clothes, or tight items like bulky ear protection. I love that these fit into my purse and are easy to access when I need them most. They are also great because you can still hear everything unlike traditional ear plugs. It just lowers the osund level to something more tolerable. I will continue to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Roderick

customer_reviews.title: Rally wanted to like them more.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 7 different brands of acoustic earplugs based on amazon and youtube reviews. Like 6 of the others these don't quite work well with my ears. The round shape is awkward. I'm not sure if they're supposed to just plug the outer portion of my ear or be inserted deeper. Either way I can't seem to get a comfortable seal. I feel like more work went into package design over function.
customer_reviews.author: sjpro

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a friend that has suffered from a head injury that has affected her balance. She has worn them for her son's football games since the noise level is just too much for her. She has said that these are perfect. She did not want to wear anything that would draw attention to her, like large headphones, and these look like she is just wearing earbuds. She told me that they cancel the noise enough that she does not have to worry about her balance, and she can enjoy the game. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: amyJo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for now.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how they're supposed to work. There like earplugs where they muffle the sound. The tube that comes out of it is capped at the end. And they did not come with any instructions on how to take it off, if it's supposed to come off. So there is no clarity. It's like putting cotton balls in my ear. Very disappointed at the moment. I'm going to check out the website and call them tomorrow to see if im doing something. Otherwise I'll be returning them. I was really really excited to get these for my son who has ADHD.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy R

customer_reviews.title: If you suffer from slight hearing loss or tinnitus, must have these
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the product effective in noisy environments, but you can still hear your friend/partner next to you. Very comfortable. They come with 3 different-sized ear buds for exact fit. If you suffer from tinnitus, as I do, these are a must if you care about yourself.
customer_reviews.author: garyj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: AHHHHJHHMAZING!! I got these for my sensory issues when noises are just too much for me to handle. They muffle just enough of the background noise out but I can still hear my toddler if he’s talking to me or needs help etc. PERFECT. Wore them today to carpet shampoo my rooms and it muffled the machine so well that I didn’t get a headache at all :) earplugs and earbuds usually hurt my ears and these don’t at all even w extended use. I wish they came in colors so they’d be easier to find when dropped
customer_reviews.author: Josh Brookley

customer_reviews.title: Generally good; some loss of sound clarity
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these did significantly reduce the volume at a concert while still letting me talk to my friends without removing them. The music wasn't muffled to the same extent it would be with standard foam earplugs, but there was definitely some loss of clarity, which may bother some people. They were comfortable enough for the 3 hours I wore them, but it's not like I could forget I had them in. More expensive concert earplugs probably work better, but if you're not a frequent concert-goer then these are a good pick.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: My review on vibes earplugs!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best earplugs I have ever bought and used! These work really great for a male adult individual who has autism. I work at a retail job so noise is constantly a thing with registers scanning items, music is playing at my work, and constant communication. I can put these in, and I get crystal clear communication from my associates! I took these on vacation just a few days ago and they were excellent to use, especially at the shooting range. In short, I would buy another pair of these again if needed. You can not go wrong with these! Thanks so much for what you do!
customer_reviews.author: MMZeroFTW

customer_reviews.title: the right amount of noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a recent music concert. The Vibes performed exactly as they claim - I could hear sounds around me and have normal conversation with others, and when the concert started they reduced the volume to a tolerable level yet the music still sounded great and I was able to enjoy the entire concert. These worked much better than standard foam ear plugs I've used in the past - I had some with me just in case the Vibes didn't work, but I did not need to use them. Easy to carry, install and remove. Best of all, no ringing in my ears at all after the show!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Fit and work great
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few other "high end" earplugs but these are the first that have actually worked. I bought them ahead of going to see Oysterhead in February (RIP concerts) and got the chance to use them 10 rows back and then around 60 rows back. They did great in both conditions allowing me to hear the show but not feel the ringing in my ear afterwards. I hopefully will be able to use them again some day. My only complaint is that they didn't come with a keychain carrying case so you have to remember to put the smalled plastic case in your pocket before you get into the party favors.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great earplugs, bad carrying case
customer_reviews.text: I used these at a concert and they work great. Cut the decibel level without muffling the sound. It's just hard to carry on a conversation with someone next to you while they're in, which makes sense. They're easy to slip in and out of your ear, much moreso than those little spongey orange ones. The carrying case is just poorly designed. It's difficult to open and if you're not careful you could easily drop the earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Mann

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to get some relief from a construction site next door. There is no difference between wearing them and not. The ad states up to 22 decibel relief. The box is comes in says 15. You get neither. To be fair, 20 decibels is the equivalent noise level of rustling leaves, a fact I wish I had researched for 3 seconds before purchasing. You might as well stick a couple of Cheetos in your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Matha

customer_reviews.title: It fits and it works.
customer_reviews.text: Item fits great, glad there are different sizes available. Will be going to an indoor large loud concert this weekend, will post update after. But so far so good. Update: wore them at the Misfits concert in Chicago, was able to hear and enjoy the music without my ears ringing for the next few days. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great for motorcycle riding!
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs are really nice, all around. Noise reduction is great, without the muffling that comes with foam earplugs, allowing me to ride my VERY loud motorcycle confidently knowing I can still hear the traffic sounds I need to hear. They do have a relatively long "stem" on them, bit I found it to be a non-issue as it sits inside my ear and doesn't get caught on my helmet. In fact, the only downside to the entire product is that the carrying case is almost as easy to lose as the plugs themselves, but a keychain pill bottle works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ken H

customer_reviews.title: Great for party work
customer_reviews.text: I loved these wee earplugs. I used them for our pool party where we have, ehum, quite large speakers and these helped me keep my sanity. I had them in for the whole party of 8 hours, no discomfort and I still could communicate with my staff. I actually ordered some more for our security who saw me use these (in particular to those who stand close to the speakers) as they saw me use em. I am sure they will appreciate it :)
customer_reviews.author: P. Lenoci

customer_reviews.title: They work well, but are poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone thru 3 pair of these and they all split in half. They're not built to last. It's unfortunate, because they're pretty comfortable and work better than any other earbuds I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R.

customer_reviews.title: Vibes are amazing, buy immediately!!
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME!! I struggle with ear plugs working for me (weird shaped inner ear? Who knows...but it’s always a problem. Thankfully the different size options for the end worked perfectly) but I also love concerts and don’t want to cause any damage to my hearing. I was amazed at how great these worked, I could still hear the music in detail and really enjoy the concert plus talk to my friends and yet I didn’t leave with my ears ringing. Plus they’re small and with the clear end it’s not super obvious you’re wearing them which I also appreciate. One-click purchase these immediately! I’m kicking myself for not buying them years earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Kiska

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective!
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very pleased. I've only had them a day, but was able to use them at a live sporting event in Dallas. I was pleased with the comfort, and while I could definitely feel that some of the sound was blocked, there was still clarity. I obviously can't speak with scientific certainty, but they provided the feeling that my ears were being protected from harmful levels of sound. If my impression changes once I've had a chance to use these more, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear, frequency response is not perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable to wear, and I was able to wear them for hours at a time without really noticing I had them in. However, I have yet to find an earplug that actually delivers on the claim that it doesn't attenuate higher frequencies more than the low frequencies. These do a better job than many others but the attenuation isn't perfectly flat, the highs are attenuated more than the lows. Still better than many others on the market. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: flyfish

customer_reviews.title: Quite pricey for only -15 dcb
customer_reviews.text: Used this for motorcycling. It does decrease the decibels a bit but not entirely. These aren't complete noise cancelling ear plugs as indicated on the box. It definitely toned down wind noise and my bike's exhaust note. Only gripe I have is after 45 minutes of ride time, it started to feel raw inside my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Fit & Comfort; Minimal Sound Enhancement
customer_reviews.text: Pretty worthless for me. I'm a concert enthusiast and wanted something better than the regular foam earplugs, so I bought these when I saw them on shark tank. They're not comfortable for me and keep sliding out of my ear - keeping them in a position where they work and no extra noise gets in is difficult even when they decide to stay in. I've tried using them during 4 different concerts spanning multiple hours, and will be going back to regular foam earplugs until I find something better; the minimal fidelity gain from these over regular earplugs aren't worth the cost or effort.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Vibes work for ASD, Sensory Processing Disorder, Hyperacusis are comfortable and virtually undetectible when wearing them.
customer_reviews.text: We love the customer service. This product works exactly as described. We purchased them after my son, with ASD, and Sensory processing disorder was diagnosed with Hyperacusis. They work. Among the many products online like these, he was drawn to Vibes since they are virtually unnoticeable. Nothing fancy or colorful about these buds, but they work great to block out background noises while allowing my son to still be present in conversations. The packaging is amazing and they come with a carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Columbiaville

customer_reviews.title: They do suppress ALL sounds!
customer_reviews.text: Recommended to me by a good friend in the same line of work. Ok earplugs, but they do suppress ALL noise and sounds including speech! I was hoping they would not. I would say its an overpriced item as regular cotton rolls work just as well !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They really work
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my trips to the super market. For some reason, the store seems to think we need music blasting at full volume to make our shopping experience more pleasant. I am not able to concentrate and rush out of there as soon as I can. I wore them for the first time today, and they really do make a difference. I could still hear the awful stuff, but it was subdued. I plan to try the other 2 sizes just to see if there is a difference. Thanks for making my life a bit less stressful.
customer_reviews.author: dblleo

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for a front row concert after seeing it on Shark Tank. I also read the reviews of people that said it worked for them so I thought I'd give it a try. I ordered 2 and it didn't reduce the noise level for us at all. My ears are still ringing so I'm pretty sure I have permanent ear damage and at this point, the damage is done. I wish I bought noise cancelling earphones instead. If you know you will be going to a concert (esp front row), I would recommend buying noise cancelling earphones instead. It is not worth betting on this tiny product to get you through.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: These are shockingly bad ear plugs, especially for the cost. They are extremely uncomfortable; they left pain in my ears for a few days afterwards. They also block out vocals and a lot of treble; music sounds very odd when you wear these. I also could not get any of the sizes to fit comfortably or make a seal. And I was sort of stunned to see that these are VERY cheap pieces of plastic; there is literally nothing justifying the price tag. I compared these with foam ear plugs and found that I preferred the foam plugs. Also, the listing her says 22 db reduction, while the box states 15db reduction. I did not appreciate being misled like that.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Concert Approved
customer_reviews.text: Last night I went to a Korn / Breaking Benjamin concert with opener Bones (UK). And as usual I found the spot directly in front of the speakers (we are talking 5 feet directly in front of me), because I love feeling the bass. Normally my ears are buzzing for at least a week after that. But last night was my first concert with my Vibes earplugs and I regret nothing. I could hear the bands clearly, I could hear the people talking around me clearly, and I woke up the next morning with no loud buzzing. I just wish I couldn't hear myself singing! I will continue using this product for the duration of my life.. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Anderson

customer_reviews.title: What a great product for noisy restaurants
customer_reviews.text: First thing is first.. Shark Tank made a mistake when they passed this up! What a great product for noisy restaurants. I have tinnitus and find it extremely difficult to hear conversations while in a someone noisy environment such as a workplace, or a night out at a bar or restaurant. These really do limit the excessively loud/static noises that make it difficult to hear and can cause hearing damage. When wearing them they go un-noticed and that is what makes them stand apart from competitors! 100% would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Rezlab92

customer_reviews.title: Protect your ears
customer_reviews.text: I like concerts, but also don't want to go deaf before I'm fifty. It took me awhile to wise up and buy some decent ear plugs. Unlike conventional ear plugs that you can get in a 20 pack, it doesn't block all sound. This filters the right amount of noise to your ear. You can still enjoy the show and hear the music clearly. It also blocks sounds from jerks behind you screaming too loud. Don't regret this purchase. They're a little small, and could easily lose them. Keep them by your side.
customer_reviews.author: Joel D Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: One fell out of my ear at outdoor concert
customer_reviews.text: I am using the smallest plug and the left one fell out of my ear. Fortunately, it was found (in the dark at that!). Comfort is good but I felt like I needed to constantly push on them to make sure they didn't pop out, but that happened anyway. Otherwise I like that they provide good noise cancellation and that I could still carry on a conversation while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Comfy to wear. . . and they Work!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other earplugs to wear when sleeping but they tend to be uncomfortable and get lost in the bedding. VIBES are comfortable and THEY DON'T FALL OUT! I am very pleased with them. The price is right. They block out just enough annoying sound so you are undisturbed but not deafened. If I lost them, I would certainly buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Clausen

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable and effective in filtering out distorted
customer_reviews.text: The compact case that comes with the ear plugs is so convenient I take them with me all the time. They are comfortable and effective in filtering out distorted, loud levels of noise. I wear them at concerts, movies, in restaurants when other voices are too loud, at sporting events in noisy arenas, and on airplanes they filter out the humming sound of the engines. I have given them as gifts and the recipients are so grateful to have them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Based on all the great reviews, I chose these ear plugs. I am autistic and noises keep me from sleeping, relaxing. I am very sensitive to noises. First, I could not tolerate these being in my ears. Second, I could still hear the sounds that bother me the most. These are things to consider if you're autistic and sensitive to most any noise. I may try headphones since they just cover the ears.
customer_reviews.author: S. CAISON

customer_reviews.title: Kills high frequencies
customer_reviews.text: This review posted by the husband--I tried these at a rock performance and was disappointed to find that they seemed to excessively attenuate high frequecies; everything sounded mushy. I was constantly trying to shift them to hear more clearly. I wouldn't recommend these; I've been happier with cotton pulled from a cotton ball.
customer_reviews.author: R Schlegelmilch

customer_reviews.title: Super lowkey, works great
customer_reviews.text: I wear these earplugs and people can't even tell! These do not cancel sounds, they tone everything down to a level where its manageable. I like to wear them when I'm having a migraine and it helps with my sound sensitivity. I would not wear these while sleeping, it would suck to lose them in bed! I wore these yesterday at the mall and it was amazingly serene for me LOL. I also love that you can just wash them off and re use them, so it is much better for the planet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bradford

customer_reviews.title: No better than disposable foam earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be something special. They work no better than cheap foam earplugs and in some ways are not as good. The rigid central post looks weird and prevents sleeping or wearing some headgear.
customer_reviews.author: Fozwort

customer_reviews.title: Great for live music
customer_reviews.text: Having bought these for live-music environments, I recently put them to the test for the first time and was not disappointed. I tried them at a large, very loud venue, and the sound seemed balanced with the earplugs in--the vocals were clear, etc.--and my ears weren't ringing afterwards. The Vibes were comfortable and unobtrusive, and the very small carrying case was useful.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Prof

customer_reviews.title: Order NOW! Don't wait!!
customer_reviews.text: Pro Tip: Keep these in your wallet or attached to something you always have with you. You'll be thankful when you unexpectedly need them and have them! I am SOOOO glad I pulled the trigger and ordered these ear plugs! Unbelievably better than the foam earplugs I've been using for the last 20 years. I was SHOCKED at how much loudness was blocked and yet I was still able to have conversations w/ my friends at the concert while wearing these. I could never do that w/ foam earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Green

customer_reviews.title: Best earplugs I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty fed up with the earplugs that my work had been supplying. They muffled sound soo much that you had to take one out just to exchange words with coworkers. That left me with slight ringing in the ear that I had to unplug ever so frequently. Thankfully, these puppies got cleared for work. (Safety manager ever got herself a pair) With Vibes, I can tell what people are saying, without having to risk my hearing by removing a plug in a loud industrial area. I'm a huge fan, and reccomend them to all my coworkers now. Very exited to try them out at a concert, next.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mercer

product_meta.title: Vibes High Fidelity Earplugs - Invisible Ear Plugs for Concerts, Musicians, Motorcycles, Airplanes, Raves, Work Noise Reduction, Hearing Protection - Fits Small Medium Large - As Seen On Shark Tank
feature_bullets: PROTECT YOUR EARS: Vibes Reusable High Fidelity Earplugs reduce damaging decibel levels to protect your ears in noisy areas without hurting sound quality. We’ve fitted noise-canceling earplugs with the best attenuating filters that lower volumes via filter specific frequencies vs outright noise cancellation. Thus our filtered sound reduction earbuds ensure a clear sound experience

VIRTUALLY INVISIBLE AND REUSABLE: With clear outer shells and form-fitting low profile silicone earbuds each noise isolating earplug is nearly undetectable. Compared to bulky noticeable plugs Vibes are discrete

MULTIPLE SIZES INCLUDED: Vibes are a comfortable, snug fit for all ear types. Adjustable silicone ear buds with sound blocking tips in multiple sizes (Small, Medium & Large) Perfect for men, women, kids, and adults to wear for long periods

HEAR CLEARLY AND COMMUNICATE EASILY: Professional acoustic ear plug pairs quiet noisy environments while isolating and filtering everything clearly. Great for: concerts, musicians, drummers, guitarists, DJs, festivals, raves, construction, fitness classes, loud work environments, dental hygienists, nightclubs, bars, sports, motorcycles, sporting events, shows, noise sensitivity, and more.
PORTABLE: Includes a hard portable case for travel. Top rated vibes are a memorable music gift for concert-goers and anyone with sensitive hearing in need of reducing volume levels.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
